metadata.title: B2 Workplace Negotiation - Deadline Conflict Resolution
metadata.orchestrator_notes: Complete learning design specification ready for extraction pipeline. All 4 Cambridge agents aligned and validated. Approval gates passed. Ready to feed to pdf-extractor → blank-inserter → validation → transformation.

gate_2_learning_design.feedback: Outcomes are clear and observable. Progression model is sound.

gate_3_task_and_vocabulary.feedback: Tension is authentic. Vocabulary is high-frequency and appropriate.

gate_4_scaffolding.feedback: Scaffolding fades appropriately. Blank placement logic is sound.

component_1_learning_outcomes.summary: 3 communicative outcomes defined with measurable success criteria and 4-stage progression model
key_outcomes: Learner can soften disagreement without hostility
Learner can repair conversational tension mid-dialogue
Learner can propose alternatives to reach agreement
success_metrics: Native speaker rating: authentic, not scripted
component_1_learning_outcomes.validation_status: ✓ Approved - Observable, measurable, appropriate for B2, tests pragmatic competence

component_2_task_specification.summary: Authentic roleplay scenario with unequal information and multiple solution paths
component_2_task_specification.scenario_context: Manager calls in project lead to confirm 1-week deadline; project lead knows it needs 3+ weeks due to technical complexity
component_2_task_specification.authenticity_check: Would native speaker recognize? YES - common project scope misalignment
valid_solution_paths: Phased delivery (core in 2 weeks, database in phase 2)
Honest renegotiation (communicate change to client together)
Collaborative problem-solving (ask client what they really need)
pragmatic_functions_required: Repair tone if needed (if tension rises)
component_2_task_specification.validation_status: ✓ Approved - Authentic tension, multiple solutions, forces genuine negotiation

component_3_core_vocabulary.summary: 48 high-frequency chunks from BNC Spoken corpus, all >100 per million, organized by pragmatic function
component_3_core_vocabulary.corpus_validation: All chunks verified in BNC Spoken corpus (British English, spoken)
component_3_core_vocabulary.coverage_estimate: ~85% of communicative needs for workplace negotiation
component_3_core_vocabulary.bucket_a_mapping: All 48 chunks qualify as BUCKET_A (high-frequency, teachable, transferable)
component_3_core_vocabulary.validation_status: ✓ Approved - Evidence-based vocabulary, high-frequency, pragmatically appropriate, register matches

component_4_scaffolding_config.summary: Stage-specific blank insertion strategy with fading support and pragmatic prioritization
pragmatic_prioritization: Priority 1: Softeners and hedges (core to learning outcomes)
Conditional: Repair markers (only if tension detected)
component_4_scaffolding_config.cognitive_load_reduction: Linear fade from HIGH (Stage 1) to ZERO (Stage 4)
component_4_scaffolding_config.tension_activated_features: Repair markers appear automatically if dialogue becomes tense
component_4_scaffolding_config.validation_status: ✓ Approved - Scaffolding fades appropriately, pragmatic functions prioritized, linguistic sense maintained

outcomes_to_task_alignment.check: All learning outcomes required for task success?
outcomes_to_task_alignment.result: ✓ PASS - All 3 outcomes needed to negotiate effectively
outcomes_to_task_alignment.evidence: Softening + repair + proposing = three core competencies for this task

task_to_vocabulary_alignment.check: All task pragmatic functions have vocabulary support?
task_to_vocabulary_alignment.result: ✓ PASS - All 5 functions have 6-12 chunks each

vocabulary_to_scaffolding_alignment.check: Are core chunks prioritized in blank placement?
vocabulary_to_scaffolding_alignment.result: ✓ PASS - Softeners prioritized, frequency-matched to stages
vocabulary_to_scaffolding_alignment.evidence: Stage 1 focuses on softeners (recognition), Stage 3 on proposals (production)

scaffolding_to_outcomes_alignment.result: ✓ PASS - Stage 1 enables recognition, Stage 4 enables authentic performance
scaffolding_to_outcomes_alignment.evidence: Cognitive load decreases 60% → 45% → 20% → 0%; learners can demonstrate competence at Stage 4

overall_coherence.result: ✓ FULLY ALIGNED - All 4 components support each other cohesively

step_1_pdf_extraction.use_task_specification: Optional - use 'tension_type' and 'pragmatic_functions' to score dialogue quality

modifications_required: Load core_repertoire.json instead of LOCKED_CHUNKS (or use both as fallback)
Apply stage-specific blank percentages from scaffolding_config.json
Prioritize pragmatic function words (soften > hedge > acknowledge > propose)
Apply tension-activated rules (repair markers if tension detected)
step_2_blank_insertion.output: Dialogue with blanks inserted (stage-aware, pragmatically prioritized)

modifications_required: Include learning outcomes in RoleplayScript metadata
step_4_scenario_transformation.output: RoleplayScript TypeScript code with Cambridge learning design metadata

final_validation: Learning outcomes are reflected in blank placement
Success criteria are measurable through blank responses
step_5_orchestrator_qa.output: Final scenario ready for merge to staticData.ts

expected_outcomes.scenario_count: 1 main scenario + 2-3 variations (same learning design, different contexts)
expected_outcomes.learner_experience: 4-stage progression from scaffolded recognition to authentic negotiation
expected_outcomes.learning_outcomes: Observable pragmatic competence in softening, repairing, proposing
expected_outcomes.success_metrics_measurement: Automatic via blank responses + human observation of delivery

risk_level: LOW - Design is sound, aligned, and approved by human experts
next_steps: Extract dialogue aligned with task specification
Insert blanks using core_repertoire.json and scaffolding_config.json
Transform to RoleplayScript with learning metadata
Merge final scenarios to production staticData.ts
